intro: Elytropappus spinellosus, commonly known as the spinellose goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in compact clusters. Elytropappus spinellosus is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
